Class MainApplicationWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
              • view.MainApplicationWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class MainApplicationWindow
extends javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
    A borderpane containing all the application's formatted main elements
    Author:
    Peter Vukas

      • selections

        public SelectionsBox selections
        The selections menu

      • processes

        public ArrayList<ProcessInfoBox> processes
        The processes contained in the process list

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainApplicationWindow

        public MainApplicationWindow(javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> start,
                             javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> randomize,
                             javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> algorithmSelection,
                             javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> processNumSelection)
        Creates a main application with 10 max processes and a max quantum value of 10
        Parameters:
        maxProcesses - The maximum amount of processes the user can select
        maxQuantum - The maximum quantum value the user can select
        start - An event handler for when the "Start" button is clicked
        randomize - An event handler for when the user requests random burst times
        algorithmSelection - An event handler for when the user selects a new algorithm
        quantumSelection - An event handler for when the user selects a new quantum value
        processNumSelection - An event handler for when the number of processes is changed

      • MainApplicationWindow

        public MainApplicationWindow(int maxProcesses,
                             int maxQuantum,
                             javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> start,
                             javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> randomize,
                             javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> algorithmSelection,
                             javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> processNumSelection)
        Creates a main application with specified max processes and quantum values
        Parameters:
        maxProcesses - The total processes the user is expected to select
        maxQuantum - The max quantum value used for round-robin calculations
        maxProcesses - The maximum amount of processes the user can select
        maxQuantum - The maximum quantum value the user can select
        start - An event handler for when the "Start" button is clicked
        randomize - An event handler for when the user requests random burst times
        algorithmSelection - An event handler for when the user selects a new algorithm
        quantumSelection - An event handler for when the user selects a new quantum value
        processNumSelection - An event handler for when the number of processes is changed

    • Method Detail

      • refreshProcessList

        public void refreshProcessList(int numberOfProcesses)
        Resets the contents of process list and fills them with the specified number of process boxes.
        Parameters:
        numberOfProcesses - Number of processes to be displayed.

      • setPrioritizedProcessList

        public void setPrioritizedProcessList(ArrayList<PrioritizedProcess> alpp)
        Populates chart with the processes in the array list
        Parameters:
        alp - Array List of prioritized processes to be converted into ProcessInfoBoxes (populated)

      • setProcessList

        public void setProcessList(ArrayList<Process> alp)
        Populates chart with the processes in the array list
        Parameters:
        alp - Array List of non-prioritized processes to be converted into ProcessInfoBoxes (populated)

      • setGanttList

        public void setGanttList(Gantt gantt)
        Takes the premade GanttBoxes and makes them into a sorted chart. All objects to be displayed in this chart should be in this array list as it cannot be appended later.
        Parameters:
        allGanttBoxes - An array list of all gantt boxes to be displayed. .sort is called automatically.

      • setAverages

        public void setAverages(Scheduler s)
        Displays the averages to the user.
        Parameters:
        s - Scheduling algorithm that was used

      • selectedProcess

        public String selectedProcess()
        Gives the shorthand of the algorithm the user has selected
        Returns:
        FIFO, SJF, P, RR, SRTF, or "" if nothing is selected
